qas.question: Who lent his voice to a campaign that aided The Sun in passing the Daily Mirror in 1978?
When did Murdoch begin expanding into the U.S?

context: The editor, Larry Lamb, was originally from a Labour background, with a socialist upbringing while his temporary replacement <a0_0>Bernard Shrimsley<a0_0/> (1972–75) was a <a1_0>middle-class uncommitted Conservative.<a1_0/> An extensive advertising campaign on the ITV network in this period, voiced by actor <a2_0>Christopher Timothy<a2_0/>, may have helped The Sun to overtake the Daily Mirror's circulation in 1978. Despite the industrial relations of the 1970s – the so-called "Spanish practices" of the print unions – The Sun was very profitable, enabling Murdoch to expand his operations to the <a3_0>United States<a3_0/> from <a4_0>1973<a4_0/>.
